intro: Hexaptera spathulata var. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf arrowhead, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, featuring heart-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its compact size and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for garden borders and container planting.
